decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended)
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

963/RDP/FIG01 (dated 15/01/2021); 963/RDP/FIG02 (dated 18/01/2021); 963/RDP/P01 - Existing Marquee Structure Plan (dated 12/04/2021); 963/RDP/P01 - Plans, Elevations & Sections (dated 24/06/2020); 963/RDP/P02 (dated 12/04/2021); 963/RDP/V01 (dated 12/04/2021); Daylight and Sunlight Assessment for the Development at No. 5 Chapel Road, Ealing (dated January 2021); 963/RDP/SA01 - Shadow Analysis (dated 17/11/2020); Energy & Sustainability Statement (Ref: E1095-ESS-01; dated 12/04/2021); Transport Statement (dated 16/04/2021); Design & Access Statement (dated April 2021).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| No construction shall take place until details of a construction method management plan have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The management plan shall include the following: delivery times (staggered to avoid afternoon and school run peak periods); dust suppression measures; erosion protection measures for excavations; site security during construction; construction vehicle and manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear; procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents. Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies D14, SI1, SI2, T4 and T7 of the London Plan (2021); the National Planning Policy Framework (2021); Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites Part 1: Noise.

| The premises shall be used as a meditation centre, and for no other purpose, including any other use within Class F1(f) of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 as amended without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: The Local Planning Authority seeks to maintain strict control over the use of the site in the interests of protecting social infrastructure, in accordance with policies 1.1(e) and 1.2(d) of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policy S1 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | There shall be no use of any amplified sound of any kind within the building.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The use as a meditation centre shall not operate outside the hours of 09:00 to 20:00 on any day.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties and commercial premises, in accordance with policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021) and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the commencement of development appropriate samples and details of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented as indicated and retained permanently, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority:
i) glazing, obscure glazing, render finish and polycarbonate canopy, detailed drawings at a minimum scale of 1:10, indicating detailed design, colour and materials of the stonework.
ii) detailed drawings at a minimum scale of 1:20 of the windows, means of opening, doors and bollards

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1, 2.1 and 2.10 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012); policies D4 & HC1 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Comprehensive details of both hard and soft landscaping works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local planning authority. These details shall include: - a) Comprehensive planting plans of an appropriate scale and level of detail that provides adequate clarity including details of ground preparation and all other operations associated with plant and grass establishment, full schedules of plants, noting species, and detailed plant sizes/root stock specifications, planting layout, proposed numbers/densities locations. b) Details of semi mature tree planting including the planting of three trees with a minimal girth of 50cm, within the site and adjacent garden of no's 55 & 56 Mattock Lane c) Comprehensive 5 year planting maintenance schedule. d) Pedestrian and vehicle access paths, patios, proposed materials and construction methods. e) Detail of porous sub base and porous surfaces to areas of access and pedestrian use. f) Details of boundary treatment. The approved landscape, trees and boundary treatment details shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained for the duration of the development. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, in pursuance to the objectives of section 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies G4 & G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations'.

| Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of commercial refuse storage and waste management (including provision for re-cycling) to include a refuse management plan and details of commercial waste storage and collection facilities shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be occupied until the elements of the approved scheme relating to the development have been implemented and those provisions shall be maintained unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policy D3, D4 & SI8 of the London Plan (2021).
description:
Construction of a two storey building with basement excavation for ancillary use to adjacent Temple (5 Chapel Road); installation of bollards to Chapel Road frontage with landscaping and boundary treatment (Following demolition of temporary marquee structure) - Retrospective Application

Construction of basement, ground and part first floor to replace a temporary marquee structure and installation of bollards to the Chapel Road frontage with landscaping and boundary treatment as an ancillary to the Temple to accommodate additional meditation facilities.
